content: Can’t help thinking that dust mites and or other organisms train the young immune system to tolerate external insults, and that stronger allergic reactions happen if this training fails. So dirt and dust mites aren’t necessarily ‘bad’. The problem of waste disposal is not usually just the ‘how’ but also the ‘how much?’. When we start stacking billions of people on top of each other things get tense. A few people can release their waste into the river, a mass of people needs to treat and divert the waste stream farther — out into the ocean, I guess, where other biological processes can usually compensate.
